main event: A UFO sighting report involving an unidentified fireball with an orange color and a streamer of bluish color traveling at an estimated speed of 1000 miles per hour and an altitude of about 30,000 feet. Witnesses observed the object disappear over the horizon and remarked on the lack of sound associated with the phenomenon.
interesting points: The object was described as traveling at a very fast rate of speed without any associated sound, indicating unconventional behavior.
One witness reported the object being visible for approximately three minutes, while another witness stated it was visible for about three seconds, leading to conflicting observations.
The witnesses reported the object emitting sparks, which is unusual behavior for a typical airborne phenomenon.
One witness provided specific details about the altitude and speed of the object, adding credibility to the observation.
The report involved credible witnesses, including a military district agent and individuals from the Oak Ridge Radiation Laboratory.
sighted object: unidentified fireball with orange and bluish colors
witnesses: military district agent, Oak Ridge Radiation Laboratory personnel
